channel.title: Hadong-gun on Every Corner of Korea

item.title: Signal from autumn-Hadong Bukcheon Cosmos, Rail Park - Hadong-gun, Gyeongnam, South Korea
item.description:
Cosmos bloomed at Bukcheon-myeon in Hadong

Signal from autumn-Hadong Bukcheon Cosmos, Rail Park

Hadong-gun, Gyeongnam, South Korea

The way people feel the change of the season is different. Scanning my body in the morning and evening, the cool breeze passing by, the warm afternoon sun, and the coffee scent of the classic cafe that feels strong today make the season change. People pass the seasonal calendar to autumn only after they feel the signs from nature with their five senses. Is the busyness of a big city blocking the fall signal and your five senses? Then, let's go to Bukcheon, Hadong-gun, Gyeongsangnam-do! Lush cosmos and dainty buckwheat flowers have been waiting for you a few days ago.
Heroine in autumn, Cosmos
The main character of Hadong in autumn is definitely Cosmos. Cosmos is full of large land around Bukcheon Station and Bukcheon Elementary School. The three buckwheat flowers, which have been carefully bloomed, are no less than the cosmos, but the soothing buckwheat flowers gave way to Cosmos for the heroine of autumn in Bukcheon-myeon. Bukcheon-myeon Cosmos Complex was built around the newly built Bukcheon Station. From Bukcheon-myeon Office and the old Bukcheon Station (Hadong Rail Park), go 1km in the direction of Hadong, and you will see the newly built Bukcheon Station. After passing Bukcheon Station, a wide cosmos complex spreads from side to side.
9/20 ~ 10/6 `` The 13th Hadong Bukcheon Cosmos Buckwheat Flower Festival '' is held
The first visitor to the cosmos complex is the tunnel of good luck. Gourds, scrubbers, snake-like cucumbers and pumpkin vines made a cozy arch tunnel. It is blessed to see the coveted parks that seem to fall on the ground even at a moment's notice. It is literally awesome.
A 'tunnel of luck' decorated with various vines
After passing through the tunnel of good luck, baekilhong (aka baekilhong) bloomed around a small pond. It feels completely different from the flowers of the pear tree, which is common in late summer and early autumn. The flowers of the pear tree are sometimes called zinnia, but the species are different. Baek Il-hong is an annual plant of the Chrysanthemum family, with large clusters and various colors. The size and density of the blossoms are so different that it does not shake heavily even in the autumn breeze. You are heavier than Cosmos. The baekilhong colony located on one side of the cosmos flower field is small in size, but it plays a role as a photo point of the Bukcheon Cosmos Complex.
Ipomoea crimson with large flowers and colorful colors
After passing the tall bridge next to Baek Il-hong, the orange flower swayed in the autumn breeze and shouted at him. It is a yellow flower cosmos. The flower has a dark orange color and is called 'yellow flower' cosmos. The orange flowers are crowded together, so they hold the camera. At the moment, it is difficult to know which angle and where to focus. However, regardless of the angle or focus, the result is not bad because the flower is filled with the flower in the frame.
A baekilhong blossomed through buckwheat flowers
Shy buckwheat flowers settled in the corner of the cosmos complex. It seems that the white flowers that filled the large fields were sprayed with white salt as described in the short story, “When the Buckwheat Flowers Fill”. Hyo-Seok Lee described the appearance as "the hillside is a buckwheat field all over, and the flowers that began to bloom are sprinkled with salty moonlight." The more you read, the more beautiful it is. A sperm standing in the distance makes the buckwheat field more rich. It seems that the old stiletto bobssangers also walked in the buckwheat flower field all night and rested in that pavilion.
Buckwheat Flower Garden in Bukcheon Cosmos Complex
From the buckwheat flower field to the entrance, around Bukcheon Elementary School, and across the road with red windmills, there is a cosmos all over the hill. If the queen of autumn chrysanthemum is 'my sister's flower' that came back from the back of youth, the fragile cosmos swayed by the wind is 'my sister's flower'. People are busy taking memories of the cosmos and the autumn breeze, leaving flowers everywhere.
9/22 ~ 10/9 The 11th Bukcheon Cosmos and Buckwheat Flower Festival is held
Alone or two or three, five or three, come in a bunch and put their memories on the autumn when they stop at Bukcheon Station for a while. The Hadong Bukcheon Cosmos and Buckwheat Flower Festival is held from September 20 to October 6. Two or three days after the festival is over, the Cosmos is replaced for the 'Poppy Festival' next spring, so it is not too long to enjoy Cosmos in Bukcheon.
We will replace Cosmos for the 'Flower Poppy Festival' next spring.
Hadong Rail Park
Now it's time to enjoy Bukcheon Cosmos more uniquely. Go to Hadong Rail Park where you can take a cool rail bike along the Cosmos Railway. Hadong Rail Park is located in the old Bukcheon Station opposite the Bukcheon-myeon Office. In July 2016, Bukcheon Station moved to its present location, and the old Bukcheon Station was refurbished as a rail bike facility. The concept of Hadong Rail Park is Cosmos. You can walk down the cool road while looking at the cosmos in full bloom throughout the 5.3km section.
Hadong Rail Park runs along Cosmos
Another competitive advantage of Hadong Rail Park is that you can enjoy the rail bike effortlessly. The rail bike section of Bukcheon Station has a slight incline, so when you go to Yangbo Station (closed station), where you depart, take the Mika Sightseeing Train or get help from a tow truck. Then, when you arrive at the starting point, you can follow the low downhill and brake elegantly. Unlike other rail bikes in other areas where sweating and legs are tingling, you need to worry about speed.
'Bukcheon Cosmos Train Cafe' remodeling a real train into a cafe
Shortly after starting the rail bike, we meet the tunnel. When entering the tunnel, colorful and mysterious lighting and exciting K-pop excite the excitement of rail viking. The tunnel about 1km long is cool even in the middle of summer, so it is good to take long clothes.
Hadong Rail Park Tunnel adds a mystery with colorful lighting
Hadong Rail Park is operated by reservation system. If you want to ride a rail bike, you can make a reservation in advance on the homepage or use an unscheduled internet on the spot. During the festival, there are many people, so it is recommended to make a reservation in advance. In history, there is a train cafe that remodels the train. If you're waiting for rail bike time or you can't ride a rail bike, it's okay to have a cup of tea in a train cafe.
Hadong Rail Park station attendant doll
The trip to Bukcheon Cosmos ends with the sound of grass and a cup of fragrant coffee. Mokyawon, opposite Bukcheon Station, is served by the owner's coffee beans. I want to enter a two-story house with a large lawn garden and terrace. Warm Americano costs 4,000 won and the price is good. Mokyawon, where you can see Bukcheon Station from anywhere in the cafe, is a real resting place for true travellers. According to the owner, "In the cosmos season, there are many customers who come by train on KORAIL or drive to Jinju Station or Suncheon Station to come to Bukcheon Station by train, visit Cosmos, drink a cup of coffee, and go." It is a true resting place for true travel enthusiasts who weave autumn, cosmos and a cup of coffee into one 'train'. During the Hadong Bukcheon Cosmos and Buckwheat Flower Festival, traffic jams are severe and parking is not easy, so it would be a wise way to travel to Bukcheon by using the train to tour the Bukcheon Cosmos Festival and returning home without any time loss at Bukcheon Station.
A cafe opposite the Bukcheon Station 'Moryeongwon'
Serves as a common room for those who enjoy Bukcheon Cosmos
Travel information

The 13th Hadong Bukcheon Cosmos and Buckwheat Flower Festival
-Period: September 20-October 6, 2019
-Place: Flower complex in Bukcheon-myeon, Hadong-gun, Gyeongsangnam-do
-Main events: harmonica ensemble performances, tourists singing and singing, Yerim performing arts performance, traditional rice cake matchup, Hadong Bukcheon agricultural products auction, raised kick contest, etc.
-Inquiries: Hadong Bukcheon Cosmos / Buckwheat Flower Farming Association Corporation 055-880-6331

http://tour.hadong.go.kr/program/tour/tourfestival/outTourFestival.asp?cate=7



Hadong Rail Park
-Location: 2446-6 Gyeongseo-daero, Bukcheon-myeon, Hadong-gun, Gyeongsangnam-do (formerly Bukcheon Station)
-Inquiries: 055-882-2244

http://www.hdrailbike.com (Only on-site ticketing is possible)


Restaurants near
-Geumyang Garden: Jaegwiguk, Jaegwihoe Bowl / 1877, Sumjingang-daero, Hadong-eup, Hadong-gun, Gyeongsangnam-do / 055-884-1580
-Member Restaurant: Origui, Oritang / 81, Hanokjeong-gil, Jeoknyang-myeon, Hadong-gun, Gyeongsangnam-do / 055-884-5289
-Taebong Restaurant: Chamgetang, Chamgegaejang / 1, Hwagae-ro, Hwagae-myeon, Hadong-gun, Gyeongsangnam-do / 055-883-2466


Rooms

-Somjin River Pension: 120, Buchun-gil, Hwagae-myeon, Hadong-gun, Gyeongsangnam-do / 055-884-8051

http://www.sumjingang.co.kr/

-Water flow: 70-17, Ssanggye-ro, Hwagae-myeon, Hadong-gun, Gyeongsangnam-do / 055-8827706, 884-1367, 010-8604-3252
http://www.sooryu.co.kr/

-Recessed pavilion: 800, Hwagae-ro, Hwagae-myeon, Hadong-gun, Gyeongsangnam-do / 055-884-0151, 010-4194-0056

http://www.쉬어가는누각펜션.com/



※ The above information was updated in September 2019, and may be changed later, so please check before you travel.

item.title: Hadong Wild Tea Culture Festival, full of fragrance, green wave following spring flowers, temptation of 'Green Tea of King' - Hadong-gun, Gyeongnam, Korea
item.description:
Hadong wild tea

Hadong Wild Tea Culture Festival, full of fragrance, green wave following spring flowers, temptation of 'Green Tea of King'

Hadong-gun, Gyeongnam, Korea

From May 19th to 22th, the king's green tea! The 22nd Hadong Wild Tea Culture Festival will be held under the theme of Hadong, a place with a thousand years of incense and fashion. Before the festival began, we decided to catch the end of the spring and take a look at Hadong's wild tea gardens along the Seomjin River.
If there is green tea in Boseong, Jeonnam, there is wild tea in Hadong, Gyeongnam. Hadong wild tea is a specialized crop of which 2,000 farms in Hwagae and Akyang-myeon earn 18 billion won annually. The tea plantation area is over 1000ha (10 million㎡, about 3 million pyeong). Hwagae-myeon is close to Seomjin River, so it is foggy, humid, and has a great environment for growing tea trees at large crossroads. Is that so? Hadong is a tea field in the land where tea cultivation has been recorded since the Silla era.
Hadong's Green Wave Announces Summer Beginning
Hadong Wild Tea Culture Festival is famous for its tea-themed tea culture festival. ‘하동’ will remind you of Seomjin River in springtime, but you will encounter a new face of Hadong through this festival.
Hadong wild tea plantation with subtle aroma and taste
‘하동’ will remind you of Seomjin River in springtime, but you will encounter a new face of Hadong through this festival.
Ssangggyesa Temple Tea View
As the theme of this trip is 'Hadong's wild car', we have designed a tour route around Hadong's tea culture sites. The main stage of the festival, Hwagae Market, Ssanggyesa Tea Market, and Hadong Wild Tea Museum will be visited.
Hadong's tea fields are waving with green waves
Hwagae Market, Ssangggyesa Tea Base, and Hadong Wildlife Culture Center will be visited.
Hadong's tea fields are waving with green waves

First, let's go to Hwagae Market. In spring, Cho Young Nam's <Hwagae Market> flows out when you enter the Hwagae Market where plum flowers and cherry blossoms scatter around the Seomjin River.

“Across the Jeolla-do and Gyeongsang-do / along the stems of the Seomjin River, Hwagae Marketplace / Lower Town Hadong People Upper Village Gurye-gun / Combined every five days. There is nothing there. … (syncopation)… … . ”

Hwagae Marketplace connecting Jeolla-do and Gyeongsang-do
Listening to the lyrical lyrics of a cheerful melody, the reporter who grew up in Seoul misses her hometown. It's a heartwarming memory of my childhood. It's simple now, but Hwagae Market has grown into a national market since it opened the gates of Seomjin River. Hwagae Market in the 21st century welcomes people in a simpler way than they thought. Even now, various herbs and herbs from Jiri Mountain are the main menu. Oh, even though it's the end, you can also enjoy cherry oysters, which are the estuaries of the Sumjin River. It's been renovated in 2014, but the boom of good times is gone. Only Hwagaejang's historical monument guards the marketplace, whispering the disappointment of the old marketplace.
Hwagae Marketplace connecting Jeolla-do and Gyeongsang-do
Hwagae-myeon Ssanggyesa Temple with Korean tea badge
If you run about 12km from Hwagae Market, you will reach Ssanggyesa Temple. The legendary Ssanggyesa Temple, Siri-ri Cherry Blossom Trail, is said to be harmful if the lovers walk together. Thanks to the spring rains, Hwagae Marketplace at the foot of the Seomjin River, Maehwa Village across the river, and Ssanggyesa Temple are suffering from the seasons. But the main character of this trip is wild car.
Ssanggyesa Temple with anti-aircraft anti-aircraft tower ratio
“Our country's tea culture started right here, at the foot of Jirisan Mountain. King Kim Dae-seol, who went to China from Tang Dynasty for three years (828 years), brought tea seeds, and the king planted them on Jirisan, according to Samguk Sagi. Ssanggyesa Temple Jangjukjeon became a valuable cultural heritage as it was the first place where tea was grown in Korea. … (syncopation)… The Hadong Wild Tea Culture Festival, which announces that this is the home of Korean tea, will be held around May 25, the annual tea day. ”
Ssanggy tea garden where you can taste fragrant Hadong green tea
This is the explanation written in front of Ssanggyesa Temple. On the tea cultivation site, along with wild tea grown as tall as adult height, Kim Dae-hyolgong's tea cultivation, which is known as Korea's oldest tea plantation, was established in 1981, the cover sheet (in 1992), and Ssangggye-sa was built to spread the tea culture. Cheon-beom-san Chuang-bi (established in 2005) is a good place to stay. Don't miss the anti-aircraft anti-aircraft pagoda (National Treasure No. 47) written by King Choi Chi-won, a teacher who resides in Ssanggyesa Temple. The inscription contains a record of Silla's tea life, such as 'Powder tea, boil and drink' or 'Tagaro' was used.
Wild Tea Garden at Ssanggyesa Tea Pond
Hadong's wild tea, which grew from the dew of Jirisan, has a nickname, 'King's Green Tea'. Once you have a feel for wild tea, go to the Hadong Culture Center.
The less sunlight, the less green tea
In addition to answering questions about wild tea, tea making experiences such as tea picking and tea picking can be made.
We value the first water car
Don't miss the Jung Geum-ri Wild Tea Tree, which boasts 1,000 years of age. It is located in City Center. It is said to be the largest and oldest tea tree in the country with a height of over 400cm.
Hadong wild tea made after boiling
TIP. Hadong Wild Tea Culture Festival
It will be held in Hwagae and Akyang-myeon for four days from May 19 to 22. There are various experience events related to Hadong wild tea at Hadong Ssanggyesa Tea Base, Hadong Wild Tea Museum, Ssanggyesa Temple, Hwagae Market, and Choi Cham Pan-dak. 055-880-2051 ~ 4
Travel info

Related website address
Hadong Wild Tea Culture Festival

http://festival.hadong.go.kr/main/index.html


Restaurants near

Wonjo Gangbyeon Haemae Restaurant: Hadong-gun Goyeon-myeon / Seongguk / 055-882-1369
Danya Restaurant: Hwagae-myeon, Hadong-gun / The Deoksan Vegetable Set Meals, Temple Noodles / 055-883-1667
Camellia Restaurant: Hwagae-myeon, Hadong-gun / Crab Crab, Ayu Sashimi, Seongphoe Society / 055-883-2439


Rooms

http://www.쉬어가는누각펜션.com/

http://www.yunwoopension.com/

http://www.sooryu.co.kr/
